paper_abstract: Let M be a given positive integer and r = (r(delta))(delta vertical bar M) a sequence indexed by the positive divisors delta of M. In this paper we present an algorithm that takes as input a generating function of the form Sigma(infinity)(n=0)a(r) (n)q(n) := Pi(delta vertical bar M) Pi(infinity)(n=1) (1 - q(delta n))(r delta) and positive integers m, N and t is an element of {0,...,m - 1}. Given this data we compute a set P-m,P-r(t) which contains t and is uniquely defined by m, r and t. Next we decide if there exists a sequence (s delta)(delta vertical bar N) indexed by the positive divisors delta of N, and modular functions b(1),...,b(k) on Gamma(0)(N) (where each b(j) equals the product of finitely many terms from {q(delta/24) Pi(infinity)(n=1) (1 - q(delta n)) : delta vertical bar N}), such that: [GRAPHICS] for some c1,...,c(k) is an element of Q and alpha := Sigma delta vertical bar N delta s delta/24 + Sigma(t') is an element of P-m,P-r(t) 24t' + Sigma(delta vertical bar M) delta r delta/24. Our algorithm builds on work by Rademacher (1942), Newman (1959), and Kolberg (1957). (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: An algorithmic approach to Ramanujan-Kolberg identities
